name: improvements
description: Comprehensive improvements to the Autopilot workflow toolkit based on real-world testing feedback and enhancement suggestions
goals: Strengthen TDD enforcement with explicit failure verification
Improve robustness for real-world project conditions (pre-existing failures, sandbox issues)
Add completion reporting and progress tracking
Better integration with external tools and services
nonGoals: Building a web UI or dashboard
Supporting languages/frameworks outside the current enum
technicalNotes: This project is markdown/documentation-based. Changes affect prompt files in /commands/ and schema files. No traditional unit tests - verification is through schema validation and manual testing.
_priority_order: 1. Critical bugs blocking workflow (arg parsing, sandbox, pre-existing failures)
2. Core workflow improvements (TDD enforcement, notes bootstrap)
_step_size: One logical change per commit. Quality over speed.

requirements.description: Fix Ralph Loop skill argument parsing - args with semicolons and parentheses are interpreted as shell commands
requirements.context: The args string was being parsed by bash, breaking on `;` and `()`. Errors like 'bash: implement: command not found'.

test.description: Document the argument parsing issue and verify current behavior breaks

implement.description: Escape/quote args properly OR use different delimiter OR pass via env var/temp file

refactor.description: Ensure solution works with all special characters

verification: Args containing semicolons are passed correctly
Args containing parentheses work without bash errors

requirements.description: Document and handle sandbox blocking database connectivity
requirements.context: Tests fail with 'Can't reach database server at localhost:5432' in sandbox mode. Docker port forwarding doesn't work.

test.description: Identify where sandbox config should be documented

implement.description: Add `sandbox` config option per feedback loop in autopilot.schema.json. Update autopilot.md to construct commands with appropriate sandbox settings

refactor.description: Add helpful error message suggestions when database errors detected

verification: autopilot.schema.json has sandbox option per feedback loop
Documentation explains when to use dangerouslyDisableSandbox
autopilot.md uses sandbox config when constructing commands

requirements.description: Handle pre-existing failures that block TDD workflow
requirements.context: Pre-existing TypeScript errors or missing ESLint config blocks progress on unrelated work.

implement.description: Add `knownFailures` section to autopilot.schema.json OR implement delta-based checking. Update autopilot.md to capture baseline at start.

refactor.description: Document that projects should ideally have green feedback loops before starting

verification: autopilot.json can specify known/baseline failures to ignore
Autopilot only fails on NEW errors introduced during the session
Clear documentation on handling pre-existing issues

requirements.description: Fix notes file bootstrap - handle non-existent notes file on first run
requirements.context: Prompt says 'Read notes file first' but it doesn't exist on first run.

test.description: Review autopilot.md for notes file handling

implement.description: Update prompt to: 'Read notes file IF IT EXISTS, otherwise create with initial state'

refactor.description: Add template structure for initial notes file

verification: Autopilot handles missing notes file gracefully
Initial notes file has proper structure
No errors on first run of a new task file

requirements.description: Add explicit TDD enforcement - assert test fails before implementation
requirements.context: Currently we ask Claude to verify tests fail but there's no enforcement.

test.description: Review current TDD flow in autopilot.md

implement.description: Add explicit step: 'Run test and VERIFY it fails. If test passes, mark requirement as invalid (test isn't testing new behavior)'

refactor.description: Update JSON structure to track test-fails-first verification

verification: Prompt explicitly requires test to fail before implementation
Requirement is flagged if test passes before implementation
Clear error messaging for invalid tests

requirements.description: Generate completion summary report when autopilot finishes
requirements.context: Users need visibility into what was accomplished.

test.description: Define summary report format and content

implement.description: Add summary generation at end of autopilot.md: requirements completed vs stuck, commits made, files modified, test coverage delta if available

refactor.description: Consider saving summary to a file alongside notes

verification: Summary shows completed vs stuck requirements
Commits are listed with short descriptions

requirements.description: Add --start-from flag to resume from specific requirement
requirements.context: If autopilot stops mid-run, it restarts evaluation from scratch.

implement.description: Add argument parsing for --start-from <requirement-id>. Skip requirements before the specified ID.

refactor.description: Document the resume workflow in autopilot.md

verification: Requirements before that ID are skipped

requirements.description: Add rollback mechanism with git tags
requirements.context: If a requirement breaks things badly, need easy way to undo.

implement.description: Create git tag before each requirement (autopilot/req-{id}/start). Add /autopilot rollback <id> mode.

refactor.description: Include rollback instructions in stuck notes

verification: Git tags created at requirement start

requirements.description: Improve progress tracking with structured log
requirements.context: Current tracking via notes file and JSON is unstructured.

test.description: Design structured progress log format (YAML or JSON)

implement.description: Create progress log tracking: start time, end time, commits, files changed per requirement

refactor.description: Use git commits more intelligently to understand state

verification: Progress log captures timing per requirement

requirements.description: Smarter code-simplifier integration with explicit file tracking
requirements.context: Currently runs on 'modified files' which is vague.

implement.description: Explicitly track files modified in current requirement. Pass specific file list to code-simplifier.

refactor.description: Skip files that weren't touched

verification: Files modified per requirement are tracked

requirements.description: Add testType field for integration/E2E test support
requirements.context: Currently assumes unit tests only.

implement.description: Add `testType` field to requirements (unit, integration, e2e). Support different test commands per type.

refactor.description: Allow requirements to specify which test suites to run

verification: Different test commands per type work

requirements.description: Add TDD guidance for test isolation issues
requirements.context: Tests sharing fixtures caused conflicts during TDD cycles.

implement.description: Add guidance in AGENTS.md about checking for fixture conflicts. Consider adding 'clean test state' step.

refactor.description: Surface guidance when tests fail unexpectedly

requirements.description: Review and adjust default iteration counts for TDD
requirements.context: Default 15 iterations may be too low. Each requirement needs ~3 phases plus retries.

implement.description: Consider higher defaults for TDD mode OR make iteration smarter ('complete N requirements' instead of 'N iterations')

refactor.description: Document expected iteration counts for different task file sizes

verification: Default iterations are appropriate for typical workloads
Users can easily adjust for their needs

requirements.description: Fix feedback loop command joining with explicit &&
requirements.context: Commands are concatenated without clear joining. Need explicit &&.

implement.description: Make command joining explicit: `${TYPECHECK_CMD} && ${TEST_CMD} && ${LINT_CMD}`

refactor.description: Or run as separate steps with individual error handling

verification: Failures in earlier commands stop the chain
